so, ive been planing on upgrading my mobo this week, since mine is discontinued and so is the processor line..

i plan on upgrading both the mobo AND the processor... the thing is, one half of the internet says i need to COMPLETELY re-install winows7 for the drivers to work, and the other half of the internet said 'na just put it in, windows7 should just do it automatically, you don\'t have to delete anything'

can someone who has actually HAD experience in this field help me out?

Hi Zelda.

When I have self built my computers in the past, now counting 3.

I have always completely started from scratch..

So Full build, starting with case, psu, an cpu+motherboard+ram.

As such new versions, of windows, so XP, VISTS an Win7.

I have upgraded my First computer, new CPU, Motherboard an Ram, an in that instance it was a fresh install of windows after harddrive reformat.

I HIGHLY recommend you format your C: Hard drive (After taking all important files off), an the reinstalling Windows with the new parts.

Good luck.
I would think windows would recognize the new parts automatically, but better safe than sorry.
You do need to reinstall the Windows OS.

You do need to reinstall the Windows OS.

Give reasons why, or your statement will be dismissed.

Personally, I don\'t believe you will have to.

From what I understand, Windows keeps tabs on what hardware your computer has. Changing 1 or two things and Windows will accept it. Changing all the parts, and Windows thinks it\'s been copied/installed on a new computer (breaking the licensing agreement).

A mobo is the central point of all your hardware, so it\'s possible Windows would freak, but I really doubt it.

But honestly, just think about it it logically.

Before you replace any hardware, backup important data to a flashdrive just in case your computer explodes.

Try booting up without reinstalling Windows.

Doesn\'t work? Okay, then format C and reinstall.

No harm done if you try not re-installing Windows.

I\'ve built a couple computers myself. I upgraded my Graphics card recently, however I have never changed out a cpu/mobo.

I don\'t think it will cause problems, so long as your not going from a 64 cpu to a 32 bit cpu (with 64 bit windows installed).

Since you said your cpu is discontinued though, this is not the case.
Windows will probably run, but it will probably ask you for your activation code or whatever it\'s called.
